column4: what does this mean and how can I use it in ubuntu "use SSH to "xxxx.xxx.xx" with the username as "register" and the password as "user""
ssh register@xxx.xxx.xx
use it as a command in the terminal ?
yes
and then how do I connect to the shell account with irssi ?
so you want to connect to a diffenrent machine with ssh and sun irssi there
YES
ssh register@xxx.xxx.xx.xx  and then you can run irssi with just commmand "irssi"
or you can screen it with "screen -S irssi irssi"
so once I do  ssh register@xxx.xxx.xx.xx the terminal window will be the terminal on the machine I connected to ?
yes.. after that ssh command it will prompt for password and then you are on the remote machine
oh ok thanks man !
np
oh one second, how do you set up your password ? " "use SSH to "xxxx.xxx.xx" with the username as "register" and the password as "user"""
i don't really know if you can give the password already with the command. why would you want to do so
oh nevermind, it asks for a password after the command
usually you don't want to type your password in cleartext
so for a shell they will know you by IP everytime you do the ssh command ?
now i didn't understand
so after you register, does the machine remember your ip? next time when you connect how do you connect - what is the command?
the same command
